channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Pandemic aid for schools is ending soon. Many after-school programs may go with it
item.description: Afterschool programs can improve students academic and social skills, and many got a big boost from pandemic relief funding. But that money is expiring soon, and some programs may disappear with it.
item.content:encoded: Afterschool programs can improve students academic and social skills, and many got a big boost from pandemic relief funding. But that money is expiring soon, and some programs may disappear with it.
item.dc:creator: Beth Wallis

item.title: From the physics of g-force to weightlessness: How it feels to launch into space
item.description: We kickoff our series Space Camp with a look at space launches. What does hurtling into space feel like? What physics are involved? And what's the "junk" in Earth's orbit?
item.content:encoded: We kickoff our series Space Camp with a look at space launches. What does hurtling into space feel like? What physics are involved? And what's the "junk" in Earth's orbit?
item.dc:creator: Regina G. Barber

item.title: 4 people are charged in a Connecticut city election misconduct case
item.description: Four people involved with a 2019 mayoral primary in Connecticut's largest city were charged for allegedly misusing absentee ballots. Similar accusations roiled the 2023 mayoral election as well.
item.content:encoded:
Four people involved with a 2019 mayoral primary in Connecticut's largest city were charged for allegedly misusing absentee ballots. Similar accusations roiled the 2023 mayoral election as well.

(Image credit: Brian A. Pounds)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk

item.title: Israel's fighting with Hezbollah, on its border with Lebanon, is intensifying
item.description: The low-level war between Israel and Lebanon is ramping up, with cross border rocket fire and emptied towns. There are fears that it could lead to a major conflagration.
item.content:encoded: The low-level war between Israel and Lebanon is ramping up, with cross border rocket fire and emptied towns. There are fears that it could lead to a major conflagration.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: What horse race journalists have to say about election reporting
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to reporter Annie Aguiar about her article in Poynter titled "What do horse race journalists think of ‘horse race journalism'?"
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks to reporter Annie Aguiar about her article in Poynter titled "What do horse race journalists think of ‘horse race journalism'?"
item.dc:creator: Linnea Anderson

item.title: Virginia NAACP sues school board that restored Confederate names
item.description: Plaintiffs in the federal lawsuit filed in Virginia include students who say they don't want to be forced to glorify or represent historical figures who fought to maintain slavery and white supremacy.
item.content:encoded: Plaintiffs in the federal lawsuit filed in Virginia include students who say they don't want to be forced to glorify or represent historical figures who fought to maintain slavery and white supremacy.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Florida ban on trans care for minors struck down
item.description: A federal judge has ruled Florida's 2023 law banning medical care for transgender children is unconstitutional. The law was a priority for Governor Ron DeSantis.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge has ruled Florida's 2023 law banning medical care for transgender children is unconstitutional. The law was a priority for Governor Ron DeSantis.
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: FBI Agents face tough times amid high housing costs
item.description: Housing costs in major cities is leading to a financial squeeze for many FBI agents. They're asking Congress to help.
item.content:encoded: Housing costs in major cities is leading to a financial squeeze for many FBI agents. They're asking Congress to help.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: What is Dental Therapy and why is the American Dental Association pushing against it?
item.description: Dental Therapy could be one solution for improving oral care in underserved rural communities. What new momentum is there for dental therapy, and why is the American Dental Association pushing back?
item.content:encoded: Dental Therapy could be one solution for improving oral care in underserved rural communities. What new momentum is there for dental therapy, and why is the American Dental Association pushing back?
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: Southern Baptist Convention will decide whether to expel churches with women pastors
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise talks to professor Beth Allison Barr about the Southern Baptist Convention’s planned vote this week on whether to expel churches where women are pastors.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise talks to professor Beth Allison Barr about the Southern Baptist Convention’s planned vote this week on whether to expel churches where women are pastors.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse
